org.efaps.jaas

Class LoginHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.jaas.LoginHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImportHandler

    public class LoginHandler
extends Object
    The login handler is used to handle the interface between JAAS and eFaps. With the name and password of the user method checkLogin(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) could be used to test if the user is allowed to login. The method returns then the related person to the given name and password (if found) or null (if not found)..
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoginHandler

        public LoginHandler(String _application)
        Constructor to initialize the login handler. If null is given to the application name, the default value defined in applicationName is used.
        Parameters:
        _application - application name of the JAAS configuration

    • Method Detail

      • checkLogin

        public Person checkLogin(String _name,
                String _passwd)
        The instance method checks if for the given user the password is correct. The test itself is done with the JAAS module from Java.
        If a person is found and successfully logged in, the last login information from the person is updated to current time stamp.
        Parameters:
        _name - name of the person name to check
        _passwd - password of the person to check
        Returns:
        found person
        See Also:
        getPerson(LoginContext), createPerson(LoginContext), updatePerson(LoginContext, Person), updateRoles(LoginContext, Person), updateGroups(LoginContext, Person)

      • getPerson

        protected Person getPerson(LoginContext _login)
                    throws EFapsException
        For the given JAAS login context the person inside eFaps is searched. If more than one person is related to the JAAS login context, an exception is thrown. If no person is found, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        _login - JAAS login context
        Returns:
        null if no person in eFaps is found for given JAAS login context
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if more than one person for given JAAS login context is found or a method of the principals inside the JAAS login contexts could not be executed.

      • createPerson

        protected Person createPerson(LoginContext _login)
                       throws EFapsException
        The person represented in the JAAS login context is created and associated to eFaps. If the person is defined in more than one JAAS system, the person is also associated to the other JAAS systems.
        Parameters:
        _login - JAAS login context
        Returns:
        Java instance of newly created person
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if a method of the principals inside the JAAS login contexts could not be executed.

      • updatePerson

        protected void updatePerson(LoginContext _login,
                Person _person)
                     throws EFapsException
        The person information inside eFaps is update with information from JAAS login context.
        Parameters:
        _login - JAAS login context
        _person - Java person instance inside eFaps to update
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if a method of the principals inside the JAAS login contexts could not be executed or the person could not be updated from the values in the JAAS login context.

      • updateRoles

        protected void updateRoles(LoginContext _login,
               Person _person)
                    throws EFapsException
        The roles of the given person are updated with the information from the JAAS login context.
        Parameters:
        _login - JAAS login context
        _person - person for which the roles must be updated
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if a method of the principals inside the JAAS login contexts could not be executed or the roles for the given person could not be set.

      • updateGroups

        protected void updateGroups(LoginContext _login,
                Person _person)
                     throws EFapsException
        The groups of the given person are updated with the information from the JAAS login context.
        Parameters:
        _login - JAAS login context
        _person - person for which the groups must be updated
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if a method of the principals inside the JAAS login contexts could not be executed or the groups for the given person could not be set.

                        throws EFapsException
        The groups of the given person are updated with the information from the JAAS login context. TODO: no real check or update is done
